posts.post_content:
@sweetestsadist: you got me curious... there are a lot of bits of flavor text about creatures eating or people being eaten by them, but how many about eating the creature described?   
  
So far, I've found Azimaet Drake, [Brindle Boar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=244824), [Bubbling Beebles](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bubbling Beebles) (see also: [Sauté](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sauté)), [Coral Eel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coral Eel), [Granite Gargoyle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Granite Gargoyle) (also referenced on [Lightning Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Axe)), [Horseshoe Crab](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=129596), [Jwari Scuttler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jwari Scuttler), [Kraken Hatchling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kraken Hatchling), [Protean Hulk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protean Hulk), [Ravenous Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=15172), [Sprouting Thrinax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprouting Thrinax), the fruit of the [Utopia Tree](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Utopia Tree), [Wall of Kelp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Kelp), Squee's lament that [Firefly](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firefly), like most bugs he found on Rath, are inedible, and a warning that eating your [Snow Hound](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snow Hound) is shor...
